definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: The following is the text of Senator Clinton's letter today to the Secretary of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 全文如下参议员克林顿的一封信，今天陆军大臣。

sentences.english: I just received a terribly grhvacious cisl from Sen. McCain.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚，麦凯恩参议员很有风范地给我打了个电话。

sentences.english: There was more  name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次参议员竞选中相互谩骂之多是我闻所未闻的。

sentences.english: The agreement still requires ratification from the full Senate and the Russian Duma.
sentences.chinese: 该协议仍然需要参议院全体议员和俄罗斯杜马的批准。

sentences.english: You know, councillor, the Manx parliament.
sentences.chinese: 您晓得，参议员，是曼克斯议会。

sentences.english: In the wake of the scandal, the senator's one-time adherents quietly deserted him.
sentences.chinese: 因为丑闻，该参议院昔日的追随者悄然弃他而去。

sentences.english: He became a Congressman at the young age of 29 and brought his frontier swagger to the Senate a year later.
sentences.chinese: 他29岁成为议员并在一年后昂首阔步进入参议院。

sentences.english: Senators Kennedy and Packwood shake their heads when they walk past you.
sentences.chinese: 参议员肯尼迪和伍德路过你时，摇摇头。

sentences.english: The Senate later passed the legislation.
sentences.chinese: 参议院后来通过了原来打算讨论的立法。

sentences.english: I have won more of the popular vote than Senator Clinton. I have more delegates than Senator Clinton.
sentences.chinese: 我比克林顿参议员赢得了更多的党内代表的票数。

sentences.english: But the previous day the Senate threw down the gauntlet to China.
sentences.chinese: 但是前一天，参议院对中国发起了挑战。

sentences.english: The senate had a session today with closed doors.
sentences.chinese: 参议院今天召开一次秘密会议。

sentences.english: Finally, he called the name of the senator from Kansas.
sentences.chinese: 最后，首席大法官叫到了这位堪萨斯州参议员的名字。

sentences.english: The Senate shall have the sole Power to try all Impeachments.
sentences.chinese: 唯参议院具有审判一切弹劾案之权。

sentences.english: The council set up a committee to enquire into local unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 参议会成立了一个委员会调查当地的失业情况。

definition: to be involved in politics/participation in politics
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
aids and advisors of top officials
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
official registrar (of a county etc) in imperial China
